title: Sri Lanka schedules 6.5-hour power cuts for April 05
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of up to 6.5 hours have been approved in Sri Lanka for April 05 Tuesday, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as severe foreign exchange shortages to import fuel was temporarily eased with fuel on borrowed money from India.
Areas A,B , C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, and L will have power cuts of four hours from 8am to 5pm and for 2 hours and 30 minutes from 500pm to 10pm.
Areas P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, and W areas will have power cuts of four hours from 10am to 6pm and for two hours and 30 minutes from 6pm to 11pm.
Area CC1 will have a 3.5 hour power cut from 6 am to 9.30am.
Sri Lanka’s electricity demand has risen amid power cuts with more people using electricity for cooking and a delay in raising prices. (Colombo/Apr044/2022)
